snippet: Driven from the Dominican Republic by force or by fear, nearly 3,000 Haitian migrants have arrived as stateless refugees in the packed camps of a borderland where cholera thrives and food is scarce.
abstract: Mass deportations of illegal migrants by Dominican Republic force thousands of Hatians over border into refugee camps, including some born in Dominican Republic but without documents to prove it; Haitian authorities ignore situation, leaving stateless refugees, haunted by history of acrimony between two countries, subject to disease and deprivation.
lead_paragraph: Driven from the Dominican Republic by force or by fear, nearly 3,000 Haitian migrants have arrived as stateless refugees in the packed camps of a borderland where cholera thrives and food is scarce.

headline.main: Forced to Flee Dominican Republic for Haiti, Migrants Land in Limbo
headline.print_headline: Haitian Migrants Flee Dominican Republic for Camps Along Border
